replies.msg: æˆ‘éƒ½è¦ºå¾—d setting é›£å·¦å¥½å¤š è€Œå®¶æ ¹æœ¬å¤¾å””åˆ° å¤¾å¾—èµ·æœƒæ‹‹è¿”å¾Œ

I heartily recommend that you climb Mount Fuji even though you aren't staying in tokyo because the rising cost of traveling there is offset by a discount on the admission. It's an arduous task but its worth it. In fact my friend who's just been there showed mr his photos taken there by which I was awestruck. He said it was well worth it fir the view from the top and the confidence that he'd gained afterwards. At night even though two of the nearby lakes dry up, the remaining lakes reflect the beauty of the stars, giving a double view of the starry sky and Mount Fuji. The shape of Mount Fuji is sharply defined against the starry nights by which you'll be awestruck. you can even pitch camp there to get the best of the night sky. Sometimes it's nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Again, the low admission charge offsets the higher transportation fee so it's definitely worth a visit. However if you ask me whether Australia is a great place to vacation in, I wouldn't bet on it. Theres nothing worth doing there. Last week my Japanese friend Keita asked if I wanted to join him for supper at his place. I replied in the affirmative. We washed two bags of rice salad and left the salad to dry out before eating it. In this way the salad contains more nutrients than when you consume it right after opening the bag. We cut the meat and peppers into dice. We peeled and diced the potatoes. After supper I said "you wash I'll dry" I went to the kitchen and stood beside him drying thr cutlery and utensils while he washed. Since it's best to dry your clothes out the night before by hanging them on the clothesline I went ahead and helped him do that. We then join his sis on a run along the promenade which felt relaxing. I bought her a pair of sneakers who said she'd pay me back if I got her those trainers. looks like she sold me a bill of goods- and then I bought a Gucci watchband but I'm wondering if it really is authentic. I might have bought a pup. After running I gave her a foot massage and dried her feet on.her brother's quilt lol and a towel. On that evening we joined with his mum in doing a sixteen thousand piece jigsaw puzzle. It was thoroughly enjoyable. His dad is a physics professor who is currently solving an exceedingly difficult question for all he's worth. Hopefully he'll find an answer to it soon. Besides physics he's an avid football fan. His favourite team madrid is currently top of the league while milan is bottom of the league. Barcelona is lying second in the league this year.Recently Rome edged Budapest three-two. Rome edged their rival Budapest into third place. The league championship is the opportunity for the best teams in the league to strut their stuff. His younger sister is a concierge who feels she's made the wrong career choice. I said "why not wipe the slate clean and start over in a different career?" Keita too suffested she study a degree course and start afresh. She blames her bad career decision on Keita. I then said "lwts just wipe the slate clean. it's over" She blames him for convincing her to be a concierge. Well that's the way the cookie crumbles.His cousin is planning on doing a phd since today a master's isn't worth the paper its printed on, let alone a bachelor degree. Last week he was almost swindled out of thousands of dollars. I told him that person was a swindler who was trying to swindle money from him The contract isn't worth the paper it's written on. Fortunately he listened to me. Otherwise the scammer would've swindled him out of thousands of dollars. I've read in the newspapers that some customers were promised to get their money back if they weren't satisfied with the products. Later they found out they'd been sold down the river as so far they have been unable to contact the swindler. Yesterday he dropped a dumbbell which dented my chair. I told him I'd wipe his slate clean if he fixed the dent in my chair.

I work at Hotel JAP Tokyo. My friend came to stay for a night as company for me while my colleagues are away. (when I'm in a hotel room I usually have the television on for company until I go to bed) Ny friend Alan got a commission for a sculpture, a sketch, an oil painting and an article on picasso from the hotel. I should like to extend my congratulations to him for having received a commission to make a sculpture, make a sketch, paint an oil painting and write an article on picasso since it's a once in a lifetime opportunity. I've always admired the exquisite colors of oil paintings be it a portrait or landscape. His palette consists of greens blues and browns while his former classmate who's also a painter paints from a palette consisting of reds whites and oranges. A palette, a set of paintbrushes and paints normally cost three thousand yen altogether. Another friend of mine has recently been promoted and assigned to the company's branch in hokkaido with which he's really pleased. I'm very pleased about his promotion too. If you happen to be staying at the aforementioned hotel please remember the following as I work there: First of all before washing your clothes please remove coins and tissue from the pockets and put only seventy percent of the dirty clothes.in the wash tub. This ensures your clothes to get evenly clean and the machine will less likely be out of order. Please towel off the drum after each use so as not to cause mould or mildew to grow in the drum. Second of all please don't set the air conditioner up to more than twenty five degrees celcius. otherwise it won't blow cold air and will smell bad. Third after cleaning the toilet and tables with detergent or sudsy water please rinse a cloth with clean water and wipe them again so as not to cause discoloration. Lastly please don't nail or stick anything to the wall as the paint will peel. Finally enjoy your time in Japan.
